channel.title: Wifi problem(solved) Screen problem
channel.description: Well, installing Kubuntu was a succes :D, but I cant get internet to work. I have a built in wifi card, a Atheros AR5007EG. Konqueror keeps saying that it cant find the host. Is there a way to install the drivers, if needed, or is my wifi card not supported by Kubuntu?

item.title: Wifi problem(solved) Screen problem
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

It is still ‘cd’, and you really shouldn’t have to switch to another tty like that, just use Konsole.

Read full topic

item.title: Wifi problem(solved) Screen problem
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Strange, it works now without changing anything. But when I change to the console with ctrl alt f2 it goes back to ‘lsd style’.

Anyways, back to the wifi problem. This is a stupid question, I know, but what is the Kubuntu equivelent of ‘cd’? Like in windows you do cd c:\program files\whatever but how do I do that in Kubuntu?

Read full topic

item.title: Wifi problem(solved) Screen problem
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

hah you screen is on lsd.

Read full topic

item.title: Wifi problem(solved) Screen problem
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

try setting your color mode to 24 bits, you can do that through kcontrol (not on linux atm though, so i’m not entirely sure where it’s located)

Read full topic

item.title: Wifi problem(solved) Screen problem
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Ok, thanks, I can get back into Kubuntu now. But the colors are all strange. Below are 2 images, one that I made with a screen capture application, and one with my mobile phone. I know it’s my video card, but I don’t know what to do. The screen is good at the login screen, but when it starts with initializing it goes crazy.

Read full topic

item.title: Wifi problem(solved) Screen problem
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

You screwed up your video drivers/settings. Type ‘sudo dpkg-reconfigure -phigh xserver-xorg’ and reboot. How do you get to a terminal? ctrl+alt+f2 Or boot into recovery mode.

Read full topic

item.title: Wifi problem(solved) Screen problem
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

R.I.P RSC:

Tell me, how can I reinstall my drives when I cant get into Kubuntu?

oops, i misread it, i thought you said you can get into the console

Read full topic

try reinstalling your drivers, or just switch to arch already

Read full topic

item.title: Wifi problem(solved) Screen problem
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

That seems to be it, but now I run into another problem. The oh so great Kubuntu doesn’t even boot anymore. Now I know it’s probably something I did wrong, but I’ve ran into more problems with Kubuntu then I ever have with Vista. First a problem with installing, then this wifi problem, and now it wont even boot. All I get is ‘loading’ or whatever, and then a black screen. Also, when switching to the console, and then back to the desktop the colors are all fucked up. In the last succesfull boot I suddenly had a 600540 or whatever sized screen, and couldnt get it back to 1024800, yes I tried system settings. I don’t have much patience, but enough for one problem. But I already had five problems in like 5 hours. So ease of setup with Kubuntu? No way.

So far my little rant. My problem, as described earlier, is that I can’t get into Kubuntu anymore. I get a loading please wait, and when I expect to get the login screen, I get a black screen. I cant get into the console, and nothing else works.

What to do? Please do not tell me to reinstall kubuntu because that will start a barrage of insults towards you and god knows who

Read full topic

item.title: Wifi problem(solved) Screen problem
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?p=3202754#post3202754

That looks like the trick.

Read full topic
